LoomSense v3 — Technical Spec Sheet

Full Multi-Dimensional Biophotonic Platform

1. Purpose

LoomSense v3 is the complete, research-grade photonic biosensing platform designed to capture the full multi-dimensional structure of ultraweak biological optical emissions. It integrates:

  • spectral

  • temporal

  • spatial

  • coherence

  • photon-counting

  • and frequency-domain dynamics

into a single unified architecture.

This version represents the full NuTech vision and serves as the foundation for scientific breakthroughs, clinical tools, and future proprietary consciousness-oriented technologies.

2. Target Biological Signals

Primary:

  • full-spectrum biophoton emissions (400–1300 nm)

  • coherence and interference patterns

  • picosecond photon correlations

  • spectral fingerprints of metabolic and microtubule states

  • terahertz-band aromatic and structural oscillations (inferred through near-visible sidebands)

Secondary:

  • MHz and GHz microtubule-derived signatures (integrated via mixed-domain analysis)

  • mitochondrial optical fluctuations

  • tissue-level coherence maps

3. Detection Dimensions

LoomSense v3 simultaneously measures:

A. Spectral Structure

  • 400–1300 nm

  • sub-nanometer resolution

  • tunable or fixed-array channels

  • high dynamic range across ultraweak signals

B. Temporal Structure

  • picosecond-level timing correlations

  • photon arrival distribution

  • burst dynamics and coherence windows

C. Spatial Structure

  • multi-waveguide routing

  • 100+ parallel optical channels

  • spatial coherence maps (via interferometry/beam-splitting)

D. Coherence Metrics

  • g(1) and g(2) correlation functions

  • resonance quality factors

  • photon bunching/antibunching signatures

  • microtubule coherence fingerprints

E. Frequency-Domain Integration

  • MHz & GHz signatures from earlier versions

  • spectral/temporal/frequency coupling

This is a fully integrated quantum biosensing platform.

4. Core Detection Modalities

A. PIC-Based Spectral Separation (Primary)

  • Arrayed Waveguide Gratings (AWGs)

  • Ring resonator spectral filters

  • echelle gratings (optional)

  • 100+ spectral channels

  • sub-nm resolution

B. Single-Photon Detection

  • SPAD (Single-Photon Avalanche Diode) arrays

  • low-dark-count APDs

  • integrated cooling or noise-minimization architecture

  • picosecond timing jitter

C. Coherence & Interferometry

  • Mach-Zehnder interferometric PIC structures

  • spatial coherence sensors

  • g(2) photon-correlation electronics

  • ultra-fast TDC (time-to-digital converter) front-end

D. Frequency-Domain Coupling

  • inherits GHz/MHz channels from v2

  • merges optical + microwave dynamics

  • enables unified multi-dimensional biological modeling

5. Hardware Architecture

  • hybrid or monolithic PIC (SiN + Si or SiN + InP)

  • 100+ optical channels

  • on-chip or hybrid SPAD arrays

  • TDC (10–50 ps resolution)

  • FPGA or ASIC for event-based photon processing

  • low-noise amplification + filtering

  • thermal stabilization enclosure

  • integrated dark-chamber housing

  • edge-AI inference module

This is the architecture used by cutting-edge quantum photonics labs — but applied for biology.

7. Data Output Format

  • full-spectrum photon count matrices

  • temporal correlation matrices

  • coherence function maps

  • multi-channel burst signatures

  • MHz/GHz crossover signatures

  • integrated biological “state space” embeddings

  • AI-ready JSON/CSV + raw binary data

This is the first biosensor that produces a quantum-grade biological dataset.

8. Key Scientific & Clinical Questions v3 Can Answer

  • How does microtubule coherence shape cellular function?

  • Do biophoton coherence flares correlate with conscious awareness?

  • Can ultraweak emission spectra reveal early-stage disease?

  • How do psychedelics, anesthesia, meditation, sleep, injury, fatigue modulate quantum biological structure?

  • Are there cross-tissue coherence networks measurable through light?

This is the version that shifts paradigms.

9. Dependencies

  • full PIC fabrication

  • SPAD integration

  • TDC / FPGA custom firmware

  • optical + GHz signal fusion software

  • calibration standards for ultraweak photon sensing

10. Position Within the Roadmap

LoomSense v3 = the final integrated platform.

Built after:

  • v1 proves feasibility

  • v2 builds the photonic + GHz architecture

v3 inherits and unifies everything.
